headline.main: Halt Called in Prisoner Exchange After British Put Nazis on a Ship; START OF BRITISH-GERMAN PRISONER EXCHANGE THAT WAS POSTPONED PRISONER EXCHANGE HALTED SUDDENLY

lead_paragraph: NEWHAVEN, England, Oct. 3 -- British authorities called a sudden halt tonight to exchange under the protection of a mercy truce of some 3,000 German and British prisoners of war, although the crippled and blinded Germans already had been carried or led aboard one of two hospital ships in this harbor.
abstract: Brit call halt after receipt of message from Germans; Germans had already embarked on 1 Brit ship; illus
